Trial_Design.evidence: patients scheduled for elective pancreatic surgery between March 2017 and February 2019 were randomized

Participants.evidence: Adult patients scheduled for elective pancreatic surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomized to either three cycles of upper-limb ischaemia and reperfusion (each 5 min) or a sham procedure

Objective.evidence: This study investigated the effect of remote ischaemic preconditioning (RIPC) on perioperative concentrations of high-sensitive cardiac troponin (hs-cTn) T and interleukin (IL) 6.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the maximum postoperative hs-cTnT concentration within 48 h after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: patients scheduled for elective pancreatic surgery between March 2017 and February 2019 were randomized

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 99 eligible patients, 46 underwent RIPC and 46 a sham procedure.

Result_Outcome.evidence: RIPC did not reduce the maximum hs-cTnT concentration after surgery (12.6 ng/l RIPC, 16.6 ng/l controls, P = 0.225)

Harms.evidence: Postoperative complications occurred in 23 RIPC and 24 control patients respectively.
